p: Tick-borne disease threats also include Crimean Congo Haemorrhagic Fever (CCHF). This viral disease is spread largely by Hyalomma ticks, is endemic in parts of Eastern and south-eastern Europe; and it appears to be emerging [ 38]. Hyalomma ticks are not endemic to the UK although they may arrive on migrant birds [ 39]; and CCHF virus may arrive in infected travellers [ 40].
